meanings.definition: Prepare (written material) for publication by correcting, condensing, or otherwise modifying it.
meanings.sent1: She edits her essay carefully before submitting it.
meanings.sent2: The editor edits the manuscript to make it more concise.
meanings.sent3: He edits his friend's story to add some humor.
meanings.sent4: Editing a document is like sculpting words to perfection.
meanings.sent5: The teacher edits the students' work to help them improve.

meanings.definition: Make changes to (data) in order to improve its accuracy or relevance.
meanings.sent1: The scientist edits the research data for errors.
meanings.sent2: The team edits the spreadsheet to update the information.
meanings.sent3: She edits the numbers to create a funny graph.
meanings.sent4: Editing data is like polishing a gem to reveal its brilliance.
meanings.sent5: He edits the report to ensure it is up-to-date.
